parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

description: An events domain that contains clinical events of interest that would not be classified as adverse events. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C85441, 2021-06-25)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the clinical event category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CECAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the clinical event?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the clinical event subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the CECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. CESCAT can only be used if there is an CECAT and it must be a subcategorization of CECAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CESCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory of the clinical event?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject experienced any clinical events. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication of whether any clinical events were experienced during the study.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: CEYN
fields.questionText: Were any clinical events experienced?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications, procedures and/or medical history records with CEs. If CMCENO or PRCENO is used, this is the identifier to which CMCENO or PRCENO refers. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: CE Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: CESPID
fields.questionText: [Sponsor defined question]

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: Reported Term for the Clinical Event

rootItem.title: Reported Term for the Clinical Event

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Clinical Event

self.title: Reported Term for the Clinical Event

fields.completionInstructions: Record the clinical event or [insert text corresponding to the specific clinical event].
fields.definition: The reported or pre-specified name of the clinical event.
fields.implementationNotes: Can be represented either as a free-text field to capture verbatim terms reported by subjects; or pre-printed, in situation where solicited CEs of interest are captured. May be used as Specify Other field to collect more details on a pre-specified CEDECOD value, or when CEDECOD=Other. In most cases, the verbatim term (i.e., investigator-reported term) will be coded to a standard medical dictionary (e.g., MedDRA, WHO ART) after the data have been collected on the CRF
fields.label: Reported Term for the Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CETERM
fields.questionText: What is the clinical event term?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if [specific clinical event] has occurred/is occurring by checking Yes or No.
fields.definition: An indication of whether a pre-specified clinical event or a group of clinical events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: The CDASH variable CEOCCUR is used to report the occurrence of pre-specified clinical event not considered to be an adverse event by the sponsor. CEOCCUR should not be used for spontaneously reported events. The site should be able to indicate that the question was not asked or answered.
fields.label: Clinical Event Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CEOCCUR
fields.questionText: Did the subject have [pre-specified clinical event/group of clinical events ]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are pre-specified on a CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation when the clinical event is pre-specified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both pre-specified CEs and free-text events, the value of CEPRESP should be "Y" for all pre-specified events and null for events reported as free text. CEPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.
fields.label: Clinical Event Pre-specified
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CEPRESP

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date of the [clinical event ] using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The start date of the clinical event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.label: Clinical Event Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CESTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] start date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: If appropriate, record the start time (as complete as possible) of the [clinical event].
fields.definition: The start time of the clinical event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collecting the time a CE started is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event started and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE start time with respect to dosing.
fields.label: Clinical Event Start Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CESTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CESTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] start time?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the anatomical location of the clinical event.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the clinical event.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Clinical Event Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CELOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the clinical event.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Clinical Event Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CELAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the clinical event.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Clinical Event Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CEDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the [clinical event]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the portion or totality of anatomical location of the clinical event.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
fields.implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: CE Location Portion or Totality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CEPORTOT
fields.questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the clinical event?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the clinical event has not resolved at the time of data collection. If ongoing, leave the end date blank.
fields.definition: Indication the clinical event is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the CE has not resolved at the time of data collection, when no end date is collected. In some cases the ongoing status may be determined from CE Outcome. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring; this field provides further confirmation that the end date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox.
fields.label: Ongoing Clinical Event
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable (e.g., CEENRF, CEENRTPT). When populating CEENRF, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the values of "DURING", "AFTER", or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating CEENRTPT, if the value of CEONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When CEONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTMIG variable CEENRF should be populated. When CEONGO is compared to another time point, the SDTMIG variables CEENRTPT and CEENTPT should be used. Note: CEENRTPT must refer to a time-point anchor described in CEENTPT.
fields.name: CEONGO
fields.prompt: Ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])
fields.questionText: Was the [clinical event] ongoing (as of [the study-specific timepoint or period]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date that the [clinical event] resolved using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the [clinical event] is ongoing, leave the field blank.
fields.definition: The date when the clinical event resolved/ ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The definition of resolved is sponsor-specific. The preferred method is to collect a complete end date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.
fields.label: Clinical Event End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CEENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] end date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the [clinical event] resolved.
fields.definition: The time when the clinical event ended/resolved, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collecting the time an CE resolved is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event resolved and the study design is such that it is important to know the CE end time with respect to dosing.
fields.label: Clinical Event End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CEENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: CEENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [clinical event] end time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: The reporting physician/healthcare professional will assess the severity of the event using the sponsor-defined categories. This assessment is subjective and the reporting physician/ healthcare professional should use medical judgment to compare the reported clinical event to similar type events observed in clinical practice.
fields.definition: The severity or intensity of the event.
fields.implementationNotes: Some studies may collect severity and/or toxicity grade.
fields.label: CE Severity/Intensity
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
fields.name: CESEV
fields.questionText: What was the severity of the [clinical event]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the description of the toxicity.
fields.definition: A description of toxicity quantified by CETOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).
fields.implementationNotes: This would typically be the text description quantified by CETOXGR (e.g., HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA).
fields.label: Clinical Event Toxicity Description
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
fields.name: CETOX
fields.questionText: What was the description of the toxicity?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the severity of the clinical event using the CTCAE toxicity grades.
fields.definition: The toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
fields.implementationNotes: Some studies may collect severity and/or toxicity grade. CDISC Controlled Terminology (TOXGRV3; TOXGRV4) may be used.
fields.label: Clinical Event Toxicity Grade
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
fields.name: CETOXGR
fields.questionText: What was the toxicity grade?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: If the value for CETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then CEMODIFY will contain the modified text.
fields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process.
fields.label: Clinical Event Modified Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: CEMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The dictionary- or sponsor-defined standardized text description of CETERM or the modified topic variable (CEMODIFY), if applicable.
fields.implementationNotes: This is typically not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).
fields.label: CE Dictionary-Derived Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
fields.name: CEDECOD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The dictionary-derived text description of the lowest level term.
fields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.
fields.label: Clinical Event Lowest Level Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
fields.name: CELLT

label: Clinical Events
name: CE
